data.fullContent: The Earth's surface is divided into major regions called biomes. Biomes are large communities of living things (plants, animals, and microorganisms) in a certain type of climate. The living things are adapted to that climate and cannot survive well outside their biome. Biomes are defined according to temperature and rainfall patterns, types of plants and animals living there, and soil conditions. Some biomes are found only in oceans, some occur only on land, and others are common to both land and water. Biomes are found in all areas of the world, even in the Arctic and Antarctic regions where temperatures are generally below freezing. They provide habitats to support the millions of plant and animal species found here on Earth.

q1.translation: 地球表面被划分为被称为生物群落的主要区域。生物群落是在某种气候下的大型生物群落(植物、动物和微生物)。生物适应了那种气候，在它们的生物群系之外无法很好地生存。生物群落是根据温度和降雨模式、生活在那里的植物和动物的类型以及土壤条件来定义的。

q1.content: The Earth's surface is ____ into major regions ____ biomes. Biomes are large communities of living ____ (plants, animals, and microorganisms) in a certain type of climate. The living things are adapted to that ____ and cannot survive well outside their biome. Biomes are defined ____ to temperature and rainfall patterns, types of ____ and animals living there, and soil conditions.

q2.translation: 地球表面被划分为被称为生物群落的主要区域。生物群落是在某种气候下的大型生物群落(植物、动物和微生物)。生物适应了那种气候，在它们的生物群系之外无法很好地生存。生物群落是根据温度和降雨模式、生活在那里的植物和动物的类型以及土壤条件来定义的。有些生物群系只存在于海洋中，有些只存在于陆地上，而另一些则在陆地和水中都有。生物群落分布在世界各地，甚至在气温通常低于冰点的北极和南极地区也有。它们为地球上数以百万计的动植物物种提供了栖息地。
q2.front: The Earth's surface is divided into major regions called biomes. Biomes are large communities of living things (plants, animals, and microorganisms) in a certain type of climate. The living things are adapted to that climate and cannot survive well outside their biome. Biomes are defined according to temperature and rainfall patterns, types of plants and animals living there, and soil conditions.
q2.middle: Some biomes are found only in oceans, some occur only on land, and others are common to both land and water.
q2.ending: Biomes are found in all areas of the world, even in the Arctic and Antarctic regions where temperatures are generally below freezing. They provide habitats to support the millions of plant and animal species found here on Earth.

options.sentence: Natural boundaries may separate areas, such as mountains, deserts, or oceans, from other regions.
The depths of the ocean are covered by thousands of species of animals and plants.
Some biomes are found only in oceans, some occur only on land, and others are common to both land and water.
However, one biome that occurs on the North American continent is the desert biome.

options.sentence: Biomes are defined according to climate, the type of plants and animals living there, and soil conditions.
Each biome contains the same general types of plants and animals and has similar numbers of species per type.
The world's climate is changing, which is caused by the burning of fossil fuels and other industrial processes.
There are seven different biomes: desert, tundra, rainforest, grassland, mangroves, deciduous forest, and coniferous forest.
